data.headline: Yancoal's Hunter Valley funding challenge gets bigger with Mitsubishi coal offer
data.summary: Fresh from offering $US2.45 billion for Rio Tinto's coal assets, Yancoal has offered to pay $US710 million for a stake in a Hunter Valley mine owned by Mitsubishi.

data.headline: Noble participation in Yancoal raising difficult: S&P
data.summary: Standard & Poors says Noble Group will find it "difficult" to participate in the equity raising Yancoal will run to fund Rio Tinto coal assets.

data.headline: Ex-Rio Tinto's Sam Walsh doesn't 'fear the truth' over Guinea scandal
data.summary: Former Rio Tinto CEO Sam Walsh says he doesn't fear the truth and doesn't expect any accusation to be made against him over the Guinea payments scandal.

data.headline: Rio unlikely to get better offer for NSW coal: EY
data.summary: An independent experts says Rio Tinto is unlikely to get a better offer for its Hunter Valley coal assets than the $US2.45 billion offer lobbed by Yancoal.

data.headline: Cheap mining shares not slave to commodity prices
data.summary: It might not feel that comfortable amid recent price declines, but resources still look like the best option for Australian sharemarket investors.

data.headline: Rio Tinto hoses down Turquoise Hill takeover talk
data.summary: Rio Tinto has hosed down speculation that it has crept up the share register of Turquoise Hill Resources.

data.headline: Mackenzie spruiks BHP growth as Elliott gets nasty
data.summary: Activist investor Elliott Associates has accused BHP Billiton of avoiding tax and misleading investors. Meanwhile, BHP chief Andrew Mackenzie has outlined bullish growth targets.

data.headline: BHP and Rio's total shareholder return is in the eye of the shareholder
data.summary: When Elliott compared BHP and Rio Tinto's total shareholder returns, it was no accident the comparison was made since 2008.

data.headline: Rio Tinto, Fortescue Metals offer olive branch to local business
data.summary: Two of the Pilbara's biggest mining companies have sweetened the terms they offer small businesses after battling anti-mining sentiment in WA.

data.headline: Mongolia backs down from local banking rule
data.summary: The Mongolian government has abandoned a proposed law that would have forced foreign investors like Rio Tinto to funnel money through Mongolian banks.

data.headline: Rio defends different treatment to exectutives over Simandou
data.summary: Rio Tinto has defended the different treatment it afforded to former executives linked to the Guinea scandal, and demanded the Queensland Government fix its power system.

data.headline: Rio Tinto offers Jacques 10 years at the top
data.summary: Rio Tinto has given chief executive Jean-Sebastien Jacques a "10-year mandate" to lead the company, in a move that has been welcomed by many Australian analysts and investors.

data.headline: How Don Argus helped Jan du Plessis release China Inc's grip on Rio Tinto
data.summary: The Simandou scandal is nothing compared to what Rio chair Jan du Plessis faced when he first took the top job at the miner.

data.headline: Korean regulators approve Yancoal's Rio Tinto deal
data.summary: Yancoal has cleared another hurdle in its bid to acquire Rio Tinto's Hunter Valley coal assets, with the Korean Fair Trade Commission giving its blessings to the deal.

data.headline: Rio Tinto strikes partnership with China's Minmetals
data.summary: Rio Tinto has struck a co-operation agreement with one of China's most powerful state-owned entities.

data.headline: Rival miner lauds activist campaign against BHP
data.summary: A rival iron ore miner has lauded Elliott Associates for launching an activist campaign against BHP Billiton.

data.headline: Rio mine named in Mongolian foreign exchange grab
data.summary: Sovereign risk has flared again in Mongolia after Rio Tinto's Oyu Tolgoi mine was named in a government plan to force foreign investors to put more funds through Mongolian banks.

data.headline: Freeport and Rio Tinto talk tough on Grasberg mine in Indonesia
data.summary: Freeport and Rio Tinto may suspend an expansion of the Grasberg copper mine in Indonesia.

data.headline: BHP seeks US shale sales to counter Elliott push
data.summary: Barely a fortnight after activist investors urged it to demerge US petroleum assets, BHP says it may sell some US shale acreage.

data.headline: Big miners court the Raging Bull of rehab
data.summary: The world's biggest miners are taking notice of a unique Australian company that is find a profitable niche in mine rehabilitation

data.headline: The price gap between iron ore grades will narrow: analysts
data.summary: The gaping delta between the prices paid for high grade and lower grade iron ores should ease in coming months, according to analysts.

data.headline: Strike-hit Escondida months from full resumption
data.summary: BHP and Rio Tinto's Escondida copper mine will take much longer than expected to resume full production.

data.headline: Rio Tinto shipped less iron ore than expected amid tough quarter
data.summary: Rio Tinto has slashed its copper production target and revealed a slow start to 2017 from its flagship iron ore division.

data.headline: Investors snap up miners as iron ore keeps falling
data.summary: The plunging iron ore price has some Australian fund managers very interested in the mining sector.

data.headline: Beny Steinmetz won't let George Soros or Rio Tinto forget Simandou
data.summary: You can't deny that Beny Steinmetz, the Israeli billionaire who has been Rio Tinto's bete noire for the best part of a decade, isn't good for a bit of drama.

data.headline: Yancoal wins FIRB approval for Rio Tinto coal deal
data.summary: Chinese dominated miner Yancoal has won approval from the FIRB to buy Rio Tinto's Hunter Valley coal mine, rail and port assets.

data.headline: Rio Tinto chairman Jan du Plessis says 'we have not admitted bribery' in Guinea
data.summary: Rio Tinto chairman Jan du Plessis has rejected a suggestion that his company has admitted to corruption and bribery in Guinea

data.headline: Rio Tinto chair Jan du Plessis labels Guinea scandal 'upsetting'
data.summary: Departing Rio Tinto chairman Jan du Plessis has faced shareholders for the first time since last year's "upsetting" payment scandal.

data.headline: Sam Walsh bonus deferral 'reasonable' says ISS
data.summary: Rio Tinto's decision to defer bonuses owed to former chief executive Sam Walsh was "reasonable" according to an influential proxy advisor, but some of its incentive targets "lack rigour".

data.headline: Rio Tinto chairman Jan du Plessis can't catch a break
data.summary: Just three days before his penultimate Rio AGM one of chairman Jan du Plessis' three new directors has hit controversy.
